channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-5431] If 10.7 or greater derbyclient.jar is in the classpath before an older release's server jars, derby fails to boot with NoSuchFieldError for JVMInfo.JAVA_SQL_TYPES_BOOLEAN
item.description:
I noticed if 10.8 derbyclient.jar is before the 10.5 server jars, DERBY fails to boot with the error below. I think this field was removed in 10.7 so most like affects 10.7 as well. The root cause is DERBY-1046, but I am filing a separate issue for this specific case. This issue is currently blocking testing with 10.8 client and 10.5 server.

$ java -Dij.exceptionTrace=true org.apache.derby.tools.ij
ij version 10.5
ij> connect 'jdbc:derby:wombat;create=true';
ERROR XJ041: Failed to create database 'wombat', see the next exception for details.
java.sql.SQLException: Failed to create database 'wombat', see the next exception for details.

item.summary: If 10.7 or greater derbyclient.jar is in the classpath before an older release's server jars, derby fails to boot with NoSuchFieldError for JVMInfo.JAVA_SQL_TYPES_BOOLEAN

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This issue was discussed on derby-dev in the following thread: http://old.nabble.com/More.-Trouble-with-JVMInfo-to32526102.html
[bulk update] Close all resolved issues that haven't been updated for more than one year.
